summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) personnel and a contractor regarding the management of electronic evidence from Jeffrey Epstein's devices in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses limiting review to responsive materials and securing non-responsive data.

events.title: Request to Lock Off Non-Responsive Epstein Materials
events.description: A request is made to lock off access to 397,365 non-responsive documents in the 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' database, leaving 1,218,719 responsive documents accessible for the case.

events.title: FBI Limits Review of Epstein's Devices
events.description: The FBI ceases reviewing all content from Epstein's devices, limiting review to documents tagged as responsive, responsive images/videos identified in a fall review, and responsive portions of iPads and an iPhone identified by SDNY.

keyFacts: The FBI ceased a full review of Jeffrey Epstein's devices and limited its review to pre-identified responsive materials as of December 2020.
The 'US v Epstein (SW Returns)' database contained 1,218,719 documents tagged as 'Identified Responsive' and 397,365 documents considered non-responsive.
Procedures were established to secure and lock off access to non-responsive materials from Epstein's devices to prevent their review by the prosecution team.
The correspondence involves coordination between the SDNY and a contractor regarding evidence management in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
